title: Look into Qdrant notification that Unindexed field artists might be slowing down queries in collection artworks_prod_v1. I dont think this can be true, since I dont search on artists. But required a little investigation. I might be wrong
close_reason: Investigation complete: artists field is only used for display, never for filtering. Qdrant warning is a false positive and can be safely ignored.

title: Migrate from Qdrant Cloud to self-hosted
Add Qdrant container to docker-compose.dev.yml with persistent volume
description: Add Qdrant service to LOCAL docker-compose.dev.yml with mounted volume for data persistence. Use official qdrant/qdrant image. Test locally before production.

title: Create fresh snapshot from Qdrant Cloud for production
description: Create a new snapshot on production day to ensure latest data is migrated.

title: Restore snapshot to PRODUCTION Qdrant instance
description: Upload fresh snapshot to production self-hosted Qdrant using priority=snapshot.

title: Update .env.prod to point to local Qdrant on server
description: Update QDRANT_URL in .env.prod on production server to point to local container.

title: Verify production data integrity and search
description: Test production site, verify 180k points, test search functionality works correctly.

title: Delete Qdrant Cloud collection to free up space
description: After production verification succeeds, delete cloud collection to stop using free tier storage. Keep cloud account for potential future use.

title: Create snapshot of Qdrant Cloud collection via API
description: Use Qdrant Python client or REST API to create snapshot of the production collection. List snapshots to get the filename.

title: Download snapshot file from Qdrant Cloud
description: Download snapshot file via REST API GET endpoint to local machine or production server.

title: Restore snapshot to local Qdrant instance
description: Upload snapshot file to self-hosted Qdrant using priority=snapshot to ensure data restoration. Verify version compatibility.

title: Update .env.dev to point to local Qdrant
description: Update QDRANT_URL in .env.dev to point to local container (e.g., http://qdrant:6333). Remove or update QDRANT_API_KEY if local instance doesn't need auth.

title: Verify data integrity on LOCAL instance
description: Test search queries on local dev instance, verify point count matches cloud (180k), spot-check similar image search works correctly. Run 'make develop' and test in browser.

title: Document backup strategy and recovery procedures
description: Document how to backup local Qdrant (snapshots + volume backups), recovery procedures, and monitoring for disk space.

title: BACKUP PLAN: Re-index from S3 if snapshot fails
description: If snapshot approach fails (free tier limitations, version mismatch, etc.), fall back to running 'make load-embeddings-prod' to regenerate all 180k embeddings from S3. This takes days but guarantees success. Only use if snapshot restoration doesn't work.

title: Add Qdrant container to docker-compose.prod.yml
description: After local testing succeeds, add Qdrant service to production docker-compose with mounted volume. Use same configuration as dev.

title: I have 3 unused vectors per point in qdrant. Better approach: Only add vectors when needed?
Revisit claude.md - it should probably be shorter now that I use beads?
Look into Qdrant warning about 'error':'Service internal error: Not enough space available for optimization'
update_payloads is WAY to slow with 200 thousand items in qdrant. I need to apply bulk-update or similar
